1.heading: Jihad.
1.title: "The Coalition is Continuing Offensive Operations to Establish a Stable Iraq"
1.author: G
notes: Summary: The enemies are "Al Quaeda, the Sadr militia, the Zarqawi network, Baathist insurgents, Hezbollah, the Sunni mujahedien and foreign jihads," plus some dead-enders.

4.heading: Jihad.
4.title: Johnny Jihad
4.author: story and art by Ryan Inzana.
notes: Summary: "John Sendel is a typical teenager. ... But Johnny stumbles onto fundamentalist Islam through his friend Salim, and finds a new outlet to channel his rebellious angst. ... Based on true facts of training camps run in the U.S. and inspired by the stories of John Walker Lindh and others."

7.genre: Kung fu and science fiction genres.

11.heading: Jijé (Joseph Gillain), 1914-1980.
11.title: "The Emerald Lake"
11.author: Jean Giraud ; story by P
11.appears_in: Christin ; introduction by Joseph Gillain (Jijé). p. 52-56 in Blueberry's Secret (New York : Catalan Communications, 1989) ; story also appears (p. 42-45) in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 9 (Dec. 1982).
notes: Summary: In early eighteenth century Brazil, Fernao Diaz of Sao Paulo spends his life looking for a lake of emeralds told of by Indians. He finds it, but dies before he can get back home. Story drawn by Giraud in 1966.

38.heading: Jijé (Joseph Gillain), 1914-1980--Miscellanea.

39.heading: Jijé (Joseph Gillain), 1914-1980--Miscellanea.
39.title: "Les Cases Mémorables de Thierry Smolderen et Alain Korkos" p. 71-73 in Les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 64
39.author: [No author]
notes: Smolderen (1954-) chooses a panel from the Blueberry story Tonnere à l'Ouest, which panel he had thought was by Jean Giraud but actually is the work of Jijé. Korkos (1955-) shows and describes a José Muñoz panel from Flic ou Privé (in the series called Joe's Bar in English).

61.heading: Jijé (Joseph Gillain), 1914-1980--Miscellanea.
61.title: 9 Timbres pour le 9e Art : Hommage : 10e Anniversaire du Centre Belge de la Bande Dessinée
61.author: textes, Jean Auquier.

publication info.publisher: Centre Belge de la Bande Dessinée

notes: Cancelled sheet of 9 comics-related postage stamps mounted on p. 5. Text includes illustrated articles on each of 8 strips and authors so honored: Corentin by Paul Cuvelier, Jerry Spring by Jijé, Gil Jourdan by Maurice Tillieux, La Patrouille des Castors by MiTacq, Hassan et Kaddour by Jacques Laudy, Buck Danny by Vic Hubinon, Tif et Tondu by Fernand Dineur, Timour by Sirius, and one stamp honoring the 10th anniversary of the Centre.

63.title: "Jijé : La Bougeotte"
63.author: Eric Verhoest
63.appears_in: p. 46-48 in Les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 88 (Mar. 1990).

68.heading: Jill.
68.title: Eating Steve : a Love Story
68.author: by J
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Jill hopes that a move to the countryside will help her understand why she tried to eat her boyfriend's brain, but her new life of introspection and peace is interrupted when a zombie plague begins to spread around the world.

69.heading: Jill.
69.title: Jane's World. v. 6
69.author: Paige Braddock.
notes: "Jane's mom pays a surprise visit to Spud Point and since she's not clued into Jane's 'lifestyle' Ethan has to pretend to be Jane's longtime, fake boyfriend! Too bad they didn't have time to explain this whole plan to Jane's new girlfriend, Skye. There are other speed bumps ahead for the budding romance between Jane and Skye, the biggest of which is Dorothy. Jill and Chelle embark on a South west adventure that intersects with some unsavory individuals from their mutual past."

70.heading: Jill.
70.title: "The Terror-Stalked Heiress!"
70.author: author, Carl Wessler ; illustrator, Jose Gual
notes: "Poor Jill was haunted by demons from hell! But Uncle Tom had promised to protect her, even though he'd died a long time ago!"

71.heading: "Jill."
71.title: When I'm Old and Other Stories
71.author: Gabrielle Bell.

contents.title: I ate shit and pretended to like it
I got soooo drunk last night
Fairy tale about the wicker chair

72.heading: Jill.
72.title: "Buckles Also Drinks from the Toilet on a Regular Basis"
72.author: by David Gilbert.
notes: Summary: Jill doesn't want to try Paul's concoction of "leftover goulash, calamari, some brownies, vinegar, soybeans and herbs and spices," even though Buckles likes it.

73.heading: Jill.
73.title: "Present for the Lawnmower"
73.author: Gilbert.
notes: Summary: Paul gets a present, because otherwise she makes his life miserable. Then he decides he better get something for Jill too.

notes: Summary: Paul and Jill won't let Buckles chew bones.

75.heading: Jill.

75.author: Gilbert.
notes: Summary: The vet kisses Buckles, and Jill gets jealous.

76.heading: Jill.
76.title: "You're Just Jealous of Her!"
76.author: by David Gilbert.
notes: Summary: The lawn mower broke, and Jill thinks Paul should just get rid of it.

86.heading: Jillson, Tony.
86.title: Sinergy : a Journey through Hell
86.author: series writer, Kyle Garrett ; Galen Showman, continuity artist.
notes: Summary: "Sinergy, a unique modern day Dante's Inferno, is the tale of a man embarking on a journey of mystery and importance. A journey to take him through Hell itself, to witness the fates of the sinners and their eternal torments."

Includes the work of 28 "guest artists": Brian Bendis, Jim Calafiore, Dave Cooper, Guy Davis, John Dennis, Craig Gassen, Ken Holewczynski, Eric Jackson, Anthony Jillson, Dirk Johnston, Brooke Kowalski, Paul Kowalski, Michael Lark, Vincent Locke, David Mack, Mark Masztal, Jason Moore, Troy Nixey, Nathan Pride, Wayne Reid, Mark Ricketts, Michael Rogers, Kevin Thomas, Sean Van Briesen, David Verruni, Mitch Waxman, Mark Winfrey, and Charles Yates.

92.heading: Jilting.
92.title: "Krishna and Shishupala : He was Forgiven a Hundred Times"
92.author: script, Kamala Chandrakant ; artworks, Ram Waeerkar
92.appears_in: 31 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 589 (1978, 1998 printing).
notes: Begins: "The house of King Damaghosha of Chedi was steeped in gloom. What should have been a joyous event turned out to be a nightmare. The long-awaited son, born to Damaghosha and his queen, was a freak, with four arms and three eyes."

Summary from back cover: "Shishupala's mother was shocked when she came to know that her child was destined to be killed by Krishna. She extracted a promise from him that he would forgive Shishupala a hundred offences. As he grew up, Shishupala had enough reasons to be angry with Krishna. Especially after he was jilted by Princess Rukmini, in favour of the merry-eyed cowherd. He provoked Krishna repeatedly and was forgiven a hundred thimes. And then one day Shishupala committed his hundred and first offence."
Subtitle, series and summary from 2010 printing.

93.title: "The Jilting of Supergirl!"
93.author: [No author]
93.series: Supergirl) 13 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 385
